00002 #  @package antlr3.tree
00003 # @brief ANTLR3 runtime package, treewizard module
00004 # 
00005 # A utility module to create ASTs at runtime.
00006 # See <http://www.antlr.org/wiki/display/~admin/2007/07/02/Exploring+Concept+of+TreeWizard> for an overview. Note that the API of the Python implementation is slightly different.

00040 from antlr3.constants import INVALID_TOKEN_TYPE
00041 from antlr3.tokens import CommonToken
00042 from antlr3.tree import CommonTree, CommonTreeAdaptor

00045 ##
00046 # 
00047 #     Compute a dict that is an inverted index of
00048 #     tokenNames (which maps int token types to names).
00049 #     
00050 def computeTokenTypes(tokenNames):
00051 
00052     if tokenNames is None:
00053         return {}
00054 
00055     return dict((name, type) for type, name in enumerate(tokenNames))
00056 
00057 
00058 ## token types for pattern parser
00059 EOF = -1
00060 BEGIN = 1
00061 END = 2
00062 ID = 3
00063 ARG = 4
00064 PERCENT = 5
00065 COLON = 6
00066 DOT = 7
00067 
00068 class TreePatternLexer(object):
00069     def __init__(self, pattern):
00070         ## The tree pattern to lex like "(A B C)"
00071         self.pattern = pattern
00072 
00073         ## Index into input string
00074         self.p = -1
00075 
00076         ## Current char
00077         self.c = None
00078 
00079         ## How long is the pattern in char?
00080         self.n = len(pattern)
00081 
00082         ## Set when token type is ID or ARG
00083         self.sval = None
00084 
00085         self.error = False
00086 
00087         self.consume()
00088 
00089 
00090     __idStartChar = frozenset(
00091         'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ_'
00092         )
00093     __idChar = __idStartChar | frozenset('0123456789')
00094     
00095     def nextToken(self):
00096         self.sval = ""
00097         while self.c != EOF:
00098             if self.c in (' ', '\n', '\r', '\t'):
00099                 self.consume()
00100                 continue
00101 
00102             if self.c in self.__idStartChar:
00103                 self.sval += self.c
00104                 self.consume()
00105                 while self.c in self.__idChar:
00106                     self.sval += self.c
00107                     self.consume()
00108 
00109                 return ID
00110 
00111             if self.c == '(':
00112                 self.consume()
00113                 return BEGIN
00114 
00115             if self.c == ')':
00116                 self.consume()
00117                 return END
00118 
00119             if self.c == '%':
00120                 self.consume()
00121                 return PERCENT
00122 
00123             if self.c == ':':
00124                 self.consume()
00125                 return COLON
00126 
00127             if self.c == '.':
00128                 self.consume()
00129                 return DOT
00130 
00131             if self.c == '[': # grab [x] as a string, returning x
00132                 self.consume()
00133                 while self.c != ']':
00134                     if self.c == '\\':
00135                         self.consume()
00136                         if self.c != ']':
00137                             self.sval += '\\'
00138 
00139                         self.sval += self.c
00140 
00141                     else:
00142                         self.sval += self.c
00143 
00144                     self.consume()
00145 
00146                 self.consume()
00147                 return ARG
00148 
00149             self.consume()
00150             self.error = True
00151             return EOF
00152 
00153         return EOF
00154 
00155 
00156     def consume(self):
00157         self.p += 1
00158         if self.p >= self.n:
00159             self.c = EOF
00160 
00161         else:
00162             self.c = self.pattern[self.p]
00163 
00164 
00165 class TreePatternParser(object):
00166     def __init__(self, tokenizer, wizard, adaptor):
00167         self.tokenizer = tokenizer
00168         self.wizard = wizard
00169         self.adaptor = adaptor
00170         self.ttype = tokenizer.nextToken() # kickstart
00171 
00172 
00173     def pattern(self):
00174         if self.ttype == BEGIN:
00175             return self.parseTree()
00176 
00177         elif self.ttype == ID:
00178             node = self.parseNode()
00179             if self.ttype == EOF:
00180                 return node
00181 
00182             return None # extra junk on end
00183 
00184         return None
00185 
00186 
00187     def parseTree(self):
00188         if self.ttype != BEGIN:
00189             return None
00190 
00191         self.ttype = self.tokenizer.nextToken()
00192         root = self.parseNode()
00193         if root is None:
00194             return None
00195 
00196         while self.ttype in (BEGIN, ID, PERCENT, DOT):
00197             if self.ttype == BEGIN:
00198                 subtree = self.parseTree()
00199                 self.adaptor.addChild(root, subtree)
00200 
00201             else:
00202                 child = self.parseNode()
00203                 if child is None:
00204                     return None
00205 
00206                 self.adaptor.addChild(root, child)
00207 
00208         if self.ttype != END:
00209             return None
00210 
00211         self.ttype = self.tokenizer.nextToken()
00212         return root
00213 
00214 
00215     def parseNode(self):
00216         # "%label:" prefix
00217         label = None
00218         
00219         if self.ttype == PERCENT:
00220             self.ttype = self.tokenizer.nextToken()
00221             if self.ttype != ID:
00222                 return None
00223 
00224             label = self.tokenizer.sval
00225             self.ttype = self.tokenizer.nextToken()
00226             if self.ttype != COLON:
00227                 return None
00228             
00229             self.ttype = self.tokenizer.nextToken() # move to ID following colon
00230 
00231         # Wildcard?
00232         if self.ttype == DOT:
00233             self.ttype = self.tokenizer.nextToken()
00234             wildcardPayload = CommonToken(0, ".")
00235             node = WildcardTreePattern(wildcardPayload)
00236             if label is not None:
00237                 node.label = label
00238             return node
00239 
00240         # "ID" or "ID[arg]"
00241         if self.ttype != ID:
00242             return None
00243 
00244         tokenName = self.tokenizer.sval
00245         self.ttype = self.tokenizer.nextToken()
00246         
00247         if tokenName == "nil":
00248             return self.adaptor.nil()
00249 
00250         text = tokenName
00251         # check for arg
00252         arg = None
00253         if self.ttype == ARG:
00254             arg = self.tokenizer.sval
00255             text = arg
00256             self.ttype = self.tokenizer.nextToken()
00257 
00258         # create node
00259         treeNodeType = self.wizard.getTokenType(tokenName)
00260         if treeNodeType == INVALID_TOKEN_TYPE:
00261             return None
00262 
00263         node = self.adaptor.createFromType(treeNodeType, text)
00264         if label is not None and isinstance(node, TreePattern):
00265             node.label = label
00266 
00267         if arg is not None and isinstance(node, TreePattern):
00268             node.hasTextArg = True
00269 
00270         return node
00271 
00272 
00273 ##
00274 # 
00275 #     When using %label:TOKENNAME in a tree for parse(), we must
00276 #     track the label.
00277 #     
00278 class TreePattern(CommonTree):
00279 
00280     def __init__(self, payload):
00281         CommonTree.__init__(self, payload)
00282 
00283         self.label = None
00284         self.hasTextArg = None
00285         
00286 
00287     def toString(self):
00288         if self.label is not None:
00289             return '%' + self.label + ':' + CommonTree.toString(self)
00290         
00291         else:
00292             return CommonTree.toString(self)
00293 
00294 
00295 class WildcardTreePattern(TreePattern):
00296     pass
00297

00299 ##
00300 # This adaptor creates TreePattern objects for use during scan()
00301 class TreePatternTreeAdaptor(CommonTreeAdaptor):
00302 
00303     def createWithPayload(self, payload):
00304         return TreePattern(payload)
00305 
00306 
00307 ##
00308 # 
00309 #     Build and navigate trees with this object.  Must know about the names
00310 #     of tokens so you have to pass in a map or array of token names (from which
00311 #     this class can build the map).  I.e., Token DECL means nothing unless the
00312 #     class can translate it to a token type.
00313 # 
00314 #     In order to create nodes and navigate, this class needs a TreeAdaptor.
00315 # 
00316 #     This class can build a token type -> node index for repeated use or for
00317 #     iterating over the various nodes with a particular type.
00318 # 
00319 #     This class works in conjunction with the TreeAdaptor rather than moving
00320 #     all this functionality into the adaptor.  An adaptor helps build and
00321 #     navigate trees using methods.  This class helps you do it with string
00322 #     patterns like "(A B C)".  You can create a tree from that pattern or
00323 #     match subtrees against it.
00324 #     
00325 class TreeWizard(object):
00326 
00327     def __init__(self, adaptor=None, tokenNames=None, typeMap=None):
00328         self.adaptor = adaptor
00329         if typeMap is None:
00330             self.tokenNameToTypeMap = computeTokenTypes(tokenNames)
00331 
00332         else:
00333             if tokenNames is not None:
00334                 raise ValueError("Can't have both tokenNames and typeMap")
00335 
00336             self.tokenNameToTypeMap = typeMap
00337 
00338 
00339     ##
00340     # Using the map of token names to token types, return the type.
00341     def getTokenType(self, tokenName):
00342 
00343         try:
00344             return self.tokenNameToTypeMap[tokenName]
00345         except KeyError:
00346             return INVALID_TOKEN_TYPE
00347 
00348 
00349     ##
00350     # 
00351     #         Create a tree or node from the indicated tree pattern that closely
00352     #         follows ANTLR tree grammar tree element syntax:
00353     #         
00354     #         (root child1 ... child2).
00355     #         
00356     #         You can also just pass in a node: ID
00357     #          
00358     #         Any node can have a text argument: ID[foo]
00359     #         (notice there are no quotes around foo--it's clear it's a string).
00360     #         
00361     #         nil is a special name meaning "give me a nil node".  Useful for
00362     #         making lists: (nil A B C) is a list of A B C.
00363     #         
00364     def create(self, pattern):
00365         
00366         tokenizer = TreePatternLexer(pattern)
00367         parser = TreePatternParser(tokenizer, self, self.adaptor)
00368         return parser.pattern()
00369 
00370 
00371     ##
00372     # Walk the entire tree and make a node name to nodes mapping.
00373     #         
00374     #         For now, use recursion but later nonrecursive version may be
00375     #         more efficient.  Returns a dict int -> list where the list is
00376     #         of your AST node type.  The int is the token type of the node.
00377     #         
00378     def index(self, tree):
00379 
00380         m = {}
00381         self._index(tree, m)
00382         return m
00383 
00384 
00385     ##
00386     # Do the work for index
00387     def _index(self, t, m):
00388 
00389         if t is None:
00390             return
00391 
00392         ttype = self.adaptor.getType(t)
00393         elements = m.get(ttype)
00394         if elements is None:
00395             m[ttype] = elements = []
00396 
00397         elements.append(t)
00398         for i in range(self.adaptor.getChildCount(t)):
00399             child = self.adaptor.getChild(t, i)
00400             self._index(child, m)
00401 
00402 
00403     ##
00404     # Return a list of matching token.
00405     # 
00406     #         what may either be an integer specifzing the token type to find or
00407     #         a string with a pattern that must be matched.
00408     #         
00409     #         
00410     def find(self, tree, what):
00411         
00412         if isinstance(what, (int, long)):
00413             return self._findTokenType(tree, what)
00414 
00415         elif isinstance(what, basestring):
00416             return self._findPattern(tree, what)
00417 
00418         else:
00419             raise TypeError("'what' must be string or integer")
00420 
00421 
00422     ##
00423     # Return a List of tree nodes with token type ttype
00424     def _findTokenType(self, t, ttype):
00425 
00426         nodes = []
00427 
00428         def visitor(tree, parent, childIndex, labels):
00429             nodes.append(tree)
00430 
00431         self.visit(t, ttype, visitor)
00432 
00433         return nodes
00434 
00435 
00436     ##
00437     # Return a List of subtrees matching pattern.
00438     def _findPattern(self, t, pattern):
00439         
00440         subtrees = []
00441         
00442         # Create a TreePattern from the pattern
00443         tokenizer = TreePatternLexer(pattern)
00444         parser = TreePatternParser(tokenizer, self, TreePatternTreeAdaptor())
00445         tpattern = parser.pattern()
00446         
00447         # don't allow invalid patterns
00448         if (tpattern is None or tpattern.isNil()
00449             or isinstance(tpattern, WildcardTreePattern)):
00450             return None
00451 
00452         rootTokenType = tpattern.getType()
00453 
00454         def visitor(tree, parent, childIndex, label):
00455             if self._parse(tree, tpattern, None):
00456                 subtrees.append(tree)
00457                 
00458         self.visit(t, rootTokenType, visitor)
00459 
00460         return subtrees
00461 
00462 
00463     ##
00464     # Visit every node in tree matching what, invoking the visitor.
00465     # 
00466     #         If what is a string, it is parsed as a pattern and only matching
00467     #         subtrees will be visited.
00468     #         The implementation uses the root node of the pattern in combination
00469     #         with visit(t, ttype, visitor) so nil-rooted patterns are not allowed.
00470     #         Patterns with wildcard roots are also not allowed.
00471     # 
00472     #         If what is an integer, it is used as a token type and visit will match
00473     #         all nodes of that type (this is faster than the pattern match).
00474     #         The labels arg of the visitor action method is never set (it's None)
00475     #         since using a token type rather than a pattern doesn't let us set a
00476     #         label.
00477     #         
00478     def visit(self, tree, what, visitor):
00479 
00480         if isinstance(what, (int, long)):
00481             self._visitType(tree, None, 0, what, visitor)
00482 
00483         elif isinstance(what, basestring):
00484             self._visitPattern(tree, what, visitor)
00485 
00486         else:
00487             raise TypeError("'what' must be string or integer")
00488         
00489               
00490     ##
00491     # Do the recursive work for visit
00492     def _visitType(self, t, parent, childIndex, ttype, visitor):
00493         
00494         if t is None:
00495             return
00496 
00497         if self.adaptor.getType(t) == ttype:
00498             visitor(t, parent, childIndex, None)
00499 
00500         for i in range(self.adaptor.getChildCount(t)):
00501             child = self.adaptor.getChild(t, i)
00502             self._visitType(child, t, i, ttype, visitor)
00503 
00504 
00505     ##
00506     # 
00507     #         For all subtrees that match the pattern, execute the visit action.
00508     #         
00509     def _visitPattern(self, tree, pattern, visitor):
00510 
00511         # Create a TreePattern from the pattern
00512         tokenizer = TreePatternLexer(pattern)
00513         parser = TreePatternParser(tokenizer, self, TreePatternTreeAdaptor())
00514         tpattern = parser.pattern()
00515         
00516         # don't allow invalid patterns
00517         if (tpattern is None or tpattern.isNil()
00518             or isinstance(tpattern, WildcardTreePattern)):
00519             return
00520 
00521         rootTokenType = tpattern.getType()
00522 
00523         def rootvisitor(tree, parent, childIndex, labels):
00524             labels = {}
00525             if self._parse(tree, tpattern, labels):
00526                 visitor(tree, parent, childIndex, labels)
00527                 
00528         self.visit(tree, rootTokenType, rootvisitor)
00529         
00530 
00531     ##
00532     # 
00533     #         Given a pattern like (ASSIGN %lhs:ID %rhs:.) with optional labels
00534     #         on the various nodes and '.' (dot) as the node/subtree wildcard,
00535     #         return true if the pattern matches and fill the labels Map with
00536     #         the labels pointing at the appropriate nodes.  Return false if
00537     #         the pattern is malformed or the tree does not match.
00538     # 
00539     #         If a node specifies a text arg in pattern, then that must match
00540     #         for that node in t.
00541     #         
00542     def parse(self, t, pattern, labels=None):
00543 
00544         tokenizer = TreePatternLexer(pattern)
00545         parser = TreePatternParser(tokenizer, self, TreePatternTreeAdaptor())
00546         tpattern = parser.pattern()
00547 
00548         return self._parse(t, tpattern, labels)
00549 
00550 
00551     ##
00552     # 
00553     #         Do the work for parse. Check to see if the tpattern fits the
00554     #         structure and token types in t1.  Check text if the pattern has
00555     #         text arguments on nodes.  Fill labels map with pointers to nodes
00556     #         in tree matched against nodes in pattern with labels.
00557     #   
00558     def _parse(self, t1, tpattern, labels):
00559         
00560         # make sure both are non-null
00561         if t1 is None or tpattern is None:
00562             return False
00563 
00564         # check roots (wildcard matches anything)
00565         if not isinstance(tpattern, WildcardTreePattern):
00566             if self.adaptor.getType(t1) != tpattern.getType():
00567                 return False
00568 
00569             # if pattern has text, check node text
00570             if (tpattern.hasTextArg
00571                 and self.adaptor.getText(t1) != tpattern.getText()):
00572                 return False
00573 
00574         if tpattern.label is not None and labels is not None:
00575             # map label in pattern to node in t1
00576             labels[tpattern.label] = t1
00577 
00578         # check children
00579         n1 = self.adaptor.getChildCount(t1)
00580         n2 = tpattern.getChildCount()
00581         if n1 != n2:
00582             return False
00583 
00584         for i in range(n1):
00585             child1 = self.adaptor.getChild(t1, i)
00586             child2 = tpattern.getChild(i)
00587             if not self._parse(child1, child2, labels):
00588                 return False
00589 
00590         return True
00591 
00592 
00593     ##
00594     # 
00595     #         Compare t1 and t2; return true if token types/text, structure match
00596     #         exactly.
00597     #         The trees are examined in their entirety so that (A B) does not match
00598     #         (A B C) nor (A (B C)). 
00599     #         
00600     def equals(self, t1, t2, adaptor=None):
00601 
00602         if adaptor is None:
00603             adaptor = self.adaptor
00604 
00605         return self._equals(t1, t2, adaptor)
00606 
00607 
00608     def _equals(self, t1, t2, adaptor):
00609         # make sure both are non-null
00610         if t1 is None or t2 is None:
00611             return False
00612 
00613         # check roots
00614         if adaptor.getType(t1) != adaptor.getType(t2):
00615             return False
00616 
00617         if adaptor.getText(t1) != adaptor.getText(t2):
00618             return False
00619         
00620         # check children
00621         n1 = adaptor.getChildCount(t1)
00622         n2 = adaptor.getChildCount(t2)
00623         if n1 != n2:
00624             return False
00625 
00626         for i in range(n1):
00627             child1 = adaptor.getChild(t1, i)
00628             child2 = adaptor.getChild(t2, i)
00629             if not self._equals(child1, child2, adaptor):
00630                 return False
00631 
00632         return True
00633
